ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I probably wouldn't recommend the course for a graduate student. I needed a bit more practical training on how to model a system, and I don't think I really gained it.The workload was variable.
Yes, I would definitely recommend it to people who are extremely interested in getting to know modeling.
With a reasonable class load, this class is excellent for providing biologists with a completely different view of biology.

I would recommend this class to a student who is interested in how different domain of science interact to study one question (applied math, CS, biology, physics). However, I suggest that the student already know the (mathematical) methods that are used in the course, since they are introduced only very briefly.
I would definitely recommend the course to any student in a biology-related field (see my response to Question 1).

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It definitely helps in my understanding of modeling in general and how to apply that in biology.
I am now able to use Matlab more fluently. I also understand how to model simple systems and appreciate all of the work that goes into building and optimizing biological simulations.
This course gives a very good overview of current science in systems biology.
I do not yet have a dissertation/research yet I feel that the skills and knowledge I gained in this course will prove to be very relevant and useful to me (and other PEB students) in the future.
